document.docAuthor: Loktionov, Valery M., Lelej, Arkady S. & Xu, Zai-Fu
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Priocnemis hyalinata species-group (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae), with description of a new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Priocnemis hyalinata species-group (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae), with description of a new species from China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Salius ( Priocnemis ) unicolor
Gussakovskij, 1926 : 258
, ♀. Lectotype (designated here), ♀, Russia, Primorskii Terr. [ZISP].
Priocnemis unicolor :
Gussakovskij 1930 : 233
, 266, ♀.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . Male . Body length 5.0–6.0 mm. Paramere apically with very short and strong spines and few long soft bristles dorsally; outer margin of volsella with short strong spines (Figs 8, 16). Hypopygium as in Fig. 21. Female . Body length 5.5–9.0 mm. Fore wing without distinct subapical white spot. Metasoma completely black.

Material examined .

Distribution . Russia ( Eastern Siberia: Krasnoyarsk Terr., Khakassia (new record), Irkutsk Prov.; Far East: Primorskii Terr., South Kuril Islands), Japan ( Hokkaido , Honshu) ( Loktionov & Lelej 2014 , Shimizu & Terayama 2016 ).
Remarks . The previous record from "Padun" ( Loktionov & Lelej 2014 ) belongs to Irkutsk Prov. (Bratsk).
